alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, north central Mingo, central Putnam, Lincoln, northwestern Logan, east central Wayne and northwestern Boone Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Oppy, or 13 miles north of Williamson, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Winfield, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Chapmanville, Poca, Ranger, Spurlockville, Institute and Tornado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 near mile marker 1. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 106. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 87 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 32 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, southern and western West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Putnam; Wayne
